text: This game had a surprisingly varied soundtrack by Masato Kouda. I do want to say that, looking at this art, I want a Tetris-playing machine like that even if it looks extremely unpractical. Mickey and Pete are so good they don't even need to look at their board to play.
author: SupraDarky

text: Heck, not even the board is looking at the board!

text: There's a lot going on in this song.

text: The ost for this game was so much better than it had any right to be.  For some reason, Donald’s theme is one I still remember.

text: This is probably the OST version where it doesn't have the compression. I think the PS1 had the least compression when it came to the music.
author: Redmage1000

text: Im not gonna lie I'e been subbed to this chaanel for like 6 years and knew someday you'd post the most bangin' Tetris theme of all time. My college friends and I played this as a party game due to how hard it could swing with the crazy huge pieces. Such a solid game.
author: WeAreTwoFace

text: One of the few titles that Capcom put out for the Nintendo 64. The other two being Resident Evil 2 and Mega Man 64. Pretty much shows that the N64 never gained a whole lot of 3rd party titles, unfortunately.
author: Joey Ford

text: I don't like this song. It keeps leading me to believe that Jay Kay is going to break in and start singing at any moment but he never does.

text: Big Bad DISCO WOLF!!!

text: WHAT A HUGE COINCIDENCE! I had this game's soundtrack playing in another tab! All the character themes are amazing, with Donald and Goofy's being my favorite. Menu theme is particularly nostalgic to me.

text: Rad! It Totally sounds like a slowed down, jazzier version of the Street Fighter Third Strike Theme

text: Fun fact: the guy who designed and directed this game went on to direct Breath of the Wild.

text: Very interesting. I never realized Fujibayashi was working for Capcom and directed the Oracle games and Minish Cap before switching over to Nintendo.
